documentType: FBI threat intake report / email correspondence
summary: An FBI Threat Intake Examiner forwards a tip submitted by Simone Lelchuk Melnick, a settlement fund administrator for the Epstein victim settlements, reporting threatening emails from a dissatisfied claimant. The report details her role, the involvement of Judge Jed Rakoff, and mentions that lawyers Brad Edwards and Brittany Henderson have also been threatened.

persons.name: Simone Lelchuk Melnick
persons.context: Submitted an FBI tip reporting threatening emails from a dissatisfied claimant related to her work allocating Epstein victim settlement funds from the JP Morgan Chase and Deutsche Bank cases. She is a mediator specializing in working with sexual assault victim-survivors.

persons.name: Judge Jed Rakoff
persons.context: Oversaw the settlement allocation process for the Epstein victim settlements from the bank class actions and appointed Simone Lelchuk Melnick as claims administrator. The threats have been brought to his attention for further action.

events.title: Appointment as Claims Administrator
events.description: Judge Jed Rakoff appoints Simone Lelchuk Melnick as the claims administrator for settlements from class actions against JP Morgan Chase and Deutsche Bank related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Involvement with Epstein Victims Begins
events.description: Simone Lelchuk Melnick begins working with women who were abused/assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Southern District of NY (federal court jurisdiction)
keyFacts: Simone Lelchuk Melnick was appointed by Judge Jed Rakoff to administer the multi-million dollar settlements from class actions against JP Morgan Chase and Deutsche Bank for their dealings with Jeffrey Epstein.
A dissatisfied female claimant, whose name is redacted, has sent numerous threatening emails and social media posts to Lelchuk Melnick regarding the settlement allocations.
Attorneys Brad Edwards and Brittany Henderson have also reportedly been threatened by the same claimant and have made complaints.
The threats were severe enough that Lelchuk Melnick alerted local Bedford, NY police and security at her daughter's school.
The matter has been brought to the attention of Judge Jed Rakoff for further legal advice and action.
